alert.note: Alert for Brown; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:13PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rock, northern Brown and central Keya Paha Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norden, or 14 miles west of Springview, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springview, Norden, Burton, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville and North River Trail. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 205 and 221. Highway 12 between mile markers 26 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
